translation: They all have the sage who's not yet free of desire, except for the two pure and one form.
This shows that there are a great many noble people who aren't yet free of desire.
They also form the nineteen faculties.
They are the first two fruits.
They're the first two fruits and the point of no return.
They're called noble ones who haven't yet parted with desire.
"He removes the two and purifies the one form.
This is to clarify the faculties that are removed.
If someone abides in the path of seeing, they'll remove the known and fully understood two purifications.
He'll remove the two purifications of known and fully understood.
If he abides in cultivation, he'll remove the known and fully knows the two purifications.
He's removed from the unknown and fully knows the two purifications.
He removes the one-shaped one.
Among the female and male faculties.
He removes one type at a time.

source_sentence: 以諸聖者無二形故　故欲界聖除此三淨。
translation: Because the noble ones don't have two forms, it's because the noble ones in the desire realm are excluded from these three purifications.
Other than these three purity [faculties], the other 19 faculties.
They all have them.
Commentary on the Verses and Commentaries of the Kuśa-śāstra (3rd edition)
